newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates fall on easing liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates fall on easing liquidity.

text.p: Easing liquidity in the banking system on the last day of a reserve period pulled Taiwan money rates to a lower close on Tuesday and dealers expected the rates to slide further in the near term.

The overnight interbank rate ended at 5.763 percent compared with Monday's 6.152, with 30-day commercial paper down to 6.00 from 6.30. Dealers said they expected the interbank rate to move between 5.750-6.000 percent on Wednesday.
Bond yields rose after the United States mounted air strikes on Iraq, with the 10-year 84/1 bond yield at 5.7300 and the 15-year contruction bond yield at 5.870. --Julie Hu (2-5080815)
